posts.post_content: I think wolfbear was talking about only being able to pull something from your **opponent's** graveyard and not your's. Therefore not be able to put an Ally from your graveyard into play each turn.
posts.html:
I think wolfbear was talking about only being able to pull something from your opponent's graveyard and not your's. Therefore not be able to put an Ally from your graveyard into play each turn.

Posted By: caesar1994 (1/31/2010 8:36:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think it's a bit underpowered and situational. If I already killed a good amount of my opponents creatures to have a chance that anything useful is among them, and if I have in addition a large enough army of allies in play, then why didn't I win? Early game he does nothing, late game his effect ain't important enough.  
  
If I'd want a creature to reanimate stuff I'd take something like [doomed necromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doomed necromancer) or [coffin queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=coffin queen) or [ink-eyes, servant of oni](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ink-eyes, servant of oni).  
  
If I'd want to make an ally deck, I'd take a more aggressive ally than this. It's not bad for casual stuff or something, but I wouldn't play him. 2.5/5
posts.html:

If I'd want a creature to reanimate stuff I'd take something like doomed necromancer or coffin queen or ink-eyes, servant of oni.

If I'd want to make an ally deck, I'd take a more aggressive ally than this. It's not bad for casual stuff or something, but I wouldn't play him. 2.5/5

Posted By: Gear61 (1/31/2010 9:55:37 AM)

posts.post_content:
[Doomblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doomblade) your opponent [baneslayer angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=baneslayer angel), and if you have 5 ally on the field (fairly easy if you have an ally deck) you got yourself a baneslayer angel on your side. if your opponent kill it, just retake it. If your opponent have the land [Emeria, the Sky Ruin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emeria, the Sky Ruin) you can, in respond to the emeria ability, target the same creature and bring that creature on YOUR side, denying your opponent it's land ability.  
  
Your opponent play with [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning) well have fun with a free 6 damages per turn as long that you keep 3 allies on the board. or a Siege-Gang Commander you tap a creature and receive 4 blockers, not a bad trade^^  
  
If your opponent play ally as well, then you can have some MAJOR fun  
  
your opponent play green, well I don't think of anything fun in green to steal but a blocker that when he die you do not lose an ally can e interesting. or over many turn you could start your own elf... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Your opponent play with Ball Lightning well have fun with a free 6 damages per turn as long that you keep 3 allies on the board. or a Siege-Gang Commander you tap a creature and receive 4 blockers, not a bad trade^^

If your opponent play ally as well, then you can have some MAJOR fun

Posted By: Sorxores (2/7/2010 7:13:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At my release event:   
 I dropped him with a Bojuka Brigand already out. Then next turn played a Hagra Diabolist, and then tapped to pull out another Brigand from the other side. (-3 life, and a +3/+3 Brigand - followed by -4 life and a +4/+4 Brigand )  
In another game, as the only ally on my board, pulled out a Pulse Tracker (B) over and over and over and over. I could instant block, I could send him to attack and die, and it just kept recurring.   
  
That was mostly a 'splash' allies Sealed deck, so not really focused on using him, but it was pretty strong.  
  
Constructed - if there's reliable removal (Doomblade, Tendrils) or even discard/mill it could get pretty sick, but yea, you should be winning already if that were the case...
